channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Several federal prosecutors in Minnesota resign over ICE shooting investigation
item.description: Top federal prosecutors in Minnesota resigned after the Department of Justice pressured them to investigate the widow of a woman killed by an ICE agent.
item.content:encoded: Top federal prosecutors in Minnesota resigned after the Department of Justice pressured them to investigate the widow of a woman killed by an ICE agent.
item.dc:creator: Matt Sepic

item.title: Former federal prosecutor talks about Minnesota ICE shooting probe and Trump's DOJ
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to former federal prosecutor and Politico writer Ankush Khardori about the resignation of several federal prosecutors in Minnesota over the ICE shooting probe.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to former federal prosecutor and Politico writer Ankush Khardori about the resignation of several federal prosecutors in Minnesota over the ICE shooting probe.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: How have prices changed in a year? NPR checked 114 items at Walmart
item.description: We found the effects of tariffs and extreme weather, relief (finally!) in the egg cooler, plus one case of shrinkflation.
item.content:encoded: We found the effects of tariffs and extreme weather, relief (finally!) in the egg cooler, plus one case of shrinkflation.
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: NASA set to bring astronaut (and the rest of Crew-11) home early for medical reasons
item.description: In an unprecedented move, NASA is bringing an astronaut crew home early from the International Space Station because one astronaut has an undisclosed medical condition.
item.content:encoded:
In an unprecedented move, NASA is bringing an astronaut crew home early from the International Space Station because one astronaut has an undisclosed medical condition.

(Image credit: NASA)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Federal prosecutors in Minnesota resign over ICE shooting probe, Trump gives a grievance-laden speech in Detroit, the Fed will make a decision about interest rates soon.
item.content:encoded: Federal prosecutors in Minnesota resign over ICE shooting probe, Trump gives a grievance-laden speech in Detroit, the Fed will make a decision about interest rates soon.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Johns Hopkins professor on his recent visit to Iran amid anti-government protests
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Youseph Yazdi, a professor at Johns Hopkins School of Medicine, about his recent visit to Iran, where thousands have been killed in anti-government protests.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Youseph Yazdi, a professor at Johns Hopkins School of Medicine, about his recent visit to Iran, where thousands have been killed in anti-government protests.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: A free program erased medical debt for millions of North Carolina residents
item.description: In North Carolina, 2.5 million people had their medical debt forgiven thanks to a special program that didn't cost the state a dime.
item.content:encoded: In North Carolina, 2.5 million people had their medical debt forgiven thanks to a special program that didn't cost the state a dime.
item.dc:creator: Alex Olgin

item.title: Former U.S. ambassador to Denmark talks about Trump's desire to take over Greenland
item.description: NPR's A Martinez asks Rufus Gifford, who served as U.S. ambassador to Denmark under the Obama administration, about President Trump's aspirations to take control of Greenland.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martinez asks Rufus Gifford, who served as U.S. ambassador to Denmark under the Obama administration, about President Trump's aspirations to take control of Greenland.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: French far-right leader Marine Le Pen's appeal trial begins in Paris
item.description: Marine Le Pen, a French far-right leader, was back in court Tuesday to appeal an embezzlement conviction that could put her political ambitions at risk.
item.content:encoded: Marine Le Pen, a French far-right leader, was back in court Tuesday to appeal an embezzlement conviction that could put her political ambitions at risk.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Trump's economic speech veers off-topic as he targets Biden and Powell
item.description: President Trump gave a speech in Detroit that was supposed to focus on the economy, but it veered off-topic quickly and covered a lot of unrelated ground.
item.content:encoded: President Trump gave a speech in Detroit that was supposed to focus on the economy, but it veered off-topic quickly and covered a lot of unrelated ground.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez
